website_summaries.verdict: One of the best non-Intel CPUs from the only other company in the computer processor business.
pros: Processor line offers a variety of performance specifications to find the desired speed
Included cooler features LED color lights for exposed PC towers
cons: Sluggish performance compared to most newer models

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: product was almost perfect. on paper. this thing is a beast! great clock speed, easy to OC with ryzen master.. with a fast clock speed per core, with SMT means 12 threads, perfect for gaming, and VR ? Oh its a rocket.. just one.. teeny... tiny... problem.. the cpu wasn't in the box when it arrived xD after a few heated emails with the third party and amazon themselves issue was resovled and a full refund was given and i ended up buying else where. amazon customer service? 4 stars. experience. no stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I was unsure whether to go amd or intel 8400. Although the intel is currently better for most games. I run at 4K so the difference is much smaller. In the end, i chose the amd platform for upgradability. One clear improvement was with VR. I was running a GTX 1080ti with an overclocked i5 2500 @4.4. 24000 MHz memory. The CPU usuals was always about 80% which when oculus home was open. This caused juddering - especially with steam VR games. CPU usage has now dropped to about 20% and I get mo juddering at all. Even with significant supersampling. Lastly, i didn’t have to re-install Windows. It booted and installed all necessary drivers automatically. Thoroughly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MR PETER JOHN STANBRIDGE

customer_reviews.title: ROAR!!!
customer_reviews.text: Its a beast, noticable perfoarmance boost in the games i play, CS:GO, WOW, Paladins to name 3 the supplied fan offers adequate cooling with the onboard (motherboard fitted) temperature sensors reporting an avg temp of 27 degrees C over 2 weeks. Summary: a nice CPU to build a PC around or upgrade an existing ryzen ready Motherboard too, (best check your motherboard can support it) Overall a real beast that im delighted with, pc boots up and is ready to use faster than the monitor takes to "warm up".
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Value & performance
customer_reviews.text: 1st red team build after many years of building blue team. Got to admit this blows me away! It replaced an old 4690k liquid cooled gaming rig. Although the new ryzen 3000 series are out I decided to take advantage of huge price drop on the series 2000 chip. I've coupled this with matx b450m gaming plus mobo (cheap) , 16gb of 3200mhz corsair vengeance rgb pro ddr4, my old 250gb ssd, 2nd hand coolermaster masterbox lite 3.1, older 850w coolermaster semi modular psu & my old asus gtx1070 graphics card. It flys! Total spend (due to recycled components) £374👍 Not even bothered to overclock yet, it's all air cooled, (included cpu wraith prism cooler very quiet & effective)
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: Great value if you get your timing right.
customer_reviews.text: It’s an interesting one, this. The general view is that is worth spending the £30 more to get the 2700x which is somewhat faster. However, I got my 2700 from Amazon when it was £161 which was over £120 cheaper than the X version and an absolute bargain for a fast octa core processor. Comes with the cooler, easy to install, although the cooler required a frightening amount of pressure to screw down, and is working well. Did need to re-install the graphics drivers for some reason and the Ryzen Master software, but no real problems if you are careful (I am not an IT specialist and have never built a PC, but do know the basics). Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: ThorNogson

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to Intel i5 8400
customer_reviews.text: Excellent alternative to the i5 8400. Single core performance not quite as good but barely noticeable, multi core performance is superb. Get it at the right price and this is a fantastic CPU. Stock cooler is a bit, well, rubbish. Just about passable for stock speed but recommend you get a decent cooler especially if you plan to overclock. Paired this with 16gb 3000mhz ram and an RTX2060 and this is perfect for 1080 gaming on max settings.
customer_reviews.author: DarthVaper, Dover

customer_reviews.title: Awesome CPU
customer_reviews.text: AMD are clawing it back against team Blue is if you ask me. I've got this running at 4.2Ghz on a Noctua air cooler and temps are perfectly fine. It's paired with a Strix X470-F and some GSkill 3200Mhz ram. I've got a 90%+ increase in frames from my old 4690k and Z97 rig running the same 1070ti. Though this chip isn't quite as good as the 8700k in terms of single core / gaming performance, it's £50+ cheaper and comes with a pretty decent cooler to boot; perfect for a first-time rig builder or someone that can't hash out for a £60+ cooler or AIO. Don't regret moving to the red team at all!
customer_reviews.author: M. N. Goodall

customer_reviews.title: Had no problems.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before deciding which Ryzen to go for and for bang for buck I'm very happy I went with this one. I needed my PC to be capable of editing in Photoshop quickly and easily as well as Premiere and other Adobe products. Ryzen 5 2600x accomplishes this very nicely. All the videos I edit are HD and it runs smoothly. My computer is super speedy and managing to handle anything I throw at it, so far gaming wise I've played Skyrim, Planet Coaster, Sims 3 and 4 with absolutely no problems. The stock cooler it comes with is also doing a fine and dandy job, happy with this choice.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: WRONG INFORMATION ON WEBPAGE
customer_reviews.text: Was looking at this cpu on this shop site, didn't notice that the specs from AMD where the ones for the 2700X so bought the PC then bios keeps setting base clock at 3.2? spoke to forum user updated bios on mobo still the same..annoyed just a little, scrap you page redo it give us the right specs for the cpu . AND DONT BUY FROM HERE AS NO DOUBT YOU'LL BUY A CPU AND ITS THE WRONG SPECCED ONE YOU'VE BOUGHT..WELL DONE GUYS THANKS FOR WEEKS OF WASTED TWEEKING OF MY MOBO!"!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: kk

customer_reviews.title: Great processor for gaming and data
customer_reviews.text: I needed to upgrade my computer as needed more cores than my current and threads then my current 8 cores 1 thread setup. I wanted something that could handle backtesting data heavy trading algorithms, but also a computer that could handle gaming well. The CPU is running at 3.6GHz as I have yet to find a reason to overclock it, I can run all games at max graphic (16gb DDR4 3200RAM, NVIDIA 1060 6gb) and yet the CPU has enough cores available for running other software on the side. On another positive note, the CPU with cooler was very easy to install, it took me around 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Haa

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the bucks
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted a gaming PC for Christmas, rather than just give him a pre-built system I thought it would be more educational to get the bits then have him learn how to build a PC. For the cost this processor was ideal, multiple cores and threads, and enough grunt for him to run his game and twitch in the background. To add to the value this processor comes with a cooler, already thermal pasted up and for an 11 year old the added bonus of being lit with red LED.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Really capable for the money
customer_reviews.text: I haven't really used the processor to game with anything more demanding than Minecraft as it is on a system with a 1030 but it is a brilliant performer for everything I have thrown at it. It can be a little fussy about RAM, but a little bit of patience got that sorted. For the money I would recommend it to everyone other than the most demanding power users. It doesn't seem power hungry, disk access is really fast (something I had previously felt that AMD lagged Intel in) and it manages everything with ease, including code compilations.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Son's build-first time
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this CPU did not get a 5 star across the Board was because we initially fitted the stock cooler that came with it. We had 16gb 3200 ram, 250gb ssd, 2 tb hdd, 1050ti gpu and wiifi card on b450 motherboard and it immediately started to overheat. We swapped for a deepcool gammmax 400 fan and everything was fine. The cpu is perfect for gaming, video editing, picture editing and general internet use by my son. He advises that it is fast and very stable. Great multi-core
customer_reviews.author: hxsaint

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it's great.. if it stays running!
customer_reviews.text: First one arrived with a bent pin (maybe a return job resent out or maybe just unlucky. Traditional great amazon returns policy and the new one arrived in pristine condition.) Good performance, garbage thermals and stability issues despite using "supported" hardware and up to date firmwares - maybe unlucky for a second time? Who knows, lost many many hours trying to get to the bottom of the issues. Gave up and found a new home for it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Masters

customer_reviews.title: Pure class
customer_reviews.text: Ryzen 7 2700X Base Clock Speed 3.7 GHz, 4.3 GHz Max Boost Includes Wraith Prism Cooler with LED This is an absolute beauty of a processor high speeds and a top quality fan included for around £150 it's a bargain I come from a few years old i5 and it's like light and day. I ain't used to speeds like it, think I am.a bit over exicted at having workable speeds Was easy to fit to the motherboard however the fan was a little tricky to clip in to place loving the RGB. It is possible to turn the lights off or dim them or personalised the colours to your liking
customer_reviews.author: Adam James Winch

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen 7 2700x
customer_reviews.text: Best cpu I've ever seen and it comes with a realy good cpu cooler as you can see in the picture, unfortunately it doesn't work with asus aura but it doesn't realy matter. I upgraded from an amd fx 6300 but before instalation I uninstalled some of the drivers of my old cpu and motherboard. Luckily Windows 10 is very good and was able to install all the new drivers for the cpu and motherboard without a fresh instalation of windows. I didnt even have to re activate windows. The cpu it's self is amazing and even with the stock cooler can over clock to 4 ghz with no problems. I would realy recommend this cpu to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Value Performance
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this processor from an Intel i5 4690k. Overall, seeing far more stable performance in areas of games I previously did not. Multitasking performance has improved also and I'm seeing significantly less CPU usage when I'm carrying out moderately intensive tasks. The stock fan does a good job at keeping the CPU cool but can be somewhat noisy, mainly due to how quickly and frequently the temperature and fan speed can oscillate. In general, very much worth the price and I am glad I bought this processor. A big leap over the last AMD processor I had, the 8350.
customer_reviews.author: Declan

customer_reviews.title: Best value CPU. Period.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up the Ryzen 2600 while it was on sale for 140£. I upgraded my Ryzen 1200,and oh boy,what a difference! Paired with a Corsair H100X aio it performs really good, idle temps are 30C,under stress test 58. When overclocked,idle 32,stress test 72c. It just smashes the blue team when it comes to productivity,when overclocked,the gaming performance is really competitve as well. I had no problem running mine on 4,2ghz on 1,38V,make sure you have at least 3000mhz speed ram. Best performance/value ratio CPU on the market,highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Bronson89

customer_reviews.title: Does the gaming well
customer_reviews.text: It’s basically a beast. Plays every game. You can leave it at stock and never have to worry. Probably good for streaming as well with the number of threads. In more depth, if you are gaming at 144Hz then I’d avoid unless overclocking and have fast RAM. Some games will be fine but others require more CPU power to keep the high frames. Overclocking to over 4Ghz and over 3000Mhz RAM makes a good difference. You can tell since frames increase and GPU load also increases when the 2600 is overclocked. For the money it really can do a lot and had more potential if you wish to use it. Brilliant for a midrange build.
customer_reviews.author: M Sims

customer_reviews.title: good bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: The tension arm to lock the cooler in place was a bit stiff , after a few attempts of fiddling about with the metal clip getting it in the sweet spot made it easyer . other than that , the performance of the cpu is brilliant , i can stream , also with face rig activated , discord ect all the same time , If your looking to not break the bank and these are still in stock go for it . if money wasnt an issue i probably would of went for something newer in the AMD range . But i have nothing negative to say about the 2700x
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: A must have CPU for productivity, gaming and streaming
customer_reviews.text: I bought this CPU after researching what CPU would best suit my needs. I used an array of adobe applications including photoshop and premiere pro, play video games and stream/record gameplay. This CPU is incredibly efficient at all these, it runs at a constant 4Ghz boost clocked and could be overclocked very easily. Its price is steep compared to other CPU's but its performance reflects the price very well. This CPU will definitely hold up for years to come as it is such a powerful and affordable CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Stu Hub

customer_reviews.title: Very annoyed
customer_reviews.text: No where on the page does it say that this processor requires an extra graphics card and does not allow you to use the on board graphics. Very poor advertising. Makes the more advanced motherboard I purchased pointless. The packaging came broken inside so little bits of plastic were everywhere and had mucked up the surface of the heat sink. Ha to use my own thermal paste to patch it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Pickup

customer_reviews.title: Moved from Intel but was not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Slightly better single core speed than my i5-4670 but saw the difference in multi core performance. Intel is still king for gaming as many games use either single or two cores but you never know as future games can use many cores and can make use of the extra cores. I use noctua d15 cooler and temperatures don't exceed 67 degrees Celsius on load and PB2 easily hits 4.1 and no reason to overclock.
customer_reviews.author: Karthik

customer_reviews.title: This is the cpu you need
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a cheap gaming cpu, even if your doing some editing? Look no further. This 6c/12t 3.85ghz cpu is a beast. Don't get me wrong, there are plenty of alternatives out there, but when I got this, I couldn't go back. Running at 51° with an esports Pro cooler. There are plenty of gameplay videos on this cpu. Its widely used and its perfect for everyday tasks and gaming. Modern warfare 2019 with 16gb of ram and a 5600xt gpu, is sat at 144hz at 1080p and I've had to limit the frames. This cpu is no slow coach, get stuff done.
customer_reviews.author: Jack brierley

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Totally Awsooooome! upgraded from Ryzen 5 1600 , put in my Fatal1ty AB350 Gaming-ITX/ac (upgrade bios before install) running stock speeds, currently using with my old stealth spire heatsink/fan i got with the ryzen 5 1600 while i wait for my new heatsink/fan, currently getting 40/43 idle and 65/70 under heavy load and gaming, getting extra 20fps in arma 3 :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing cpu and I'am very happy with it, but If you looking for a cpu to game I will recommend the 3600 or 3700 series. However If you still considering to buy this I will advise you to get the 2700x, you get better base speed for your games 3.7ghz for the 2700x and 3.2ghz for the 2700.
customer_reviews.author: Attila Papai

customer_reviews.title: Great price to performance ratio
customer_reviews.text: Significantly cheaper than the new Ryzen 5 3600 and similar price as the Ryzen 5 1600 CPU meant this was an obvious choice for a budget gaming media centre. No issues so far and feels good to have paid a fraction of the price for an Intel Core i5 alternative and receive such solid performance. No issues with all processing requirements which includes tasks that are CPU intensive such as gaming where lots of things are happening at the same time, i.e. Rainbow Six Siege, Wii U emulation, and more basic needs such as watching movies
customer_reviews.author: Peter S.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price to performance.
customer_reviews.text: for the price its amazing, upgraded from an a10 APU to ryzen meant I had to get a new board and ddr4 but well worth it 6 core 12 thread up from 4 core have made a massive difference when gaming even without an overclock did consider an Intel alternative at first but for the extra cost the performance difference was not justifiable. If I was a professional gamer and every extra frame mattered then I might have gone team blue but I'm not and I dont have that kind of money to throw around. Overall fantastic value for money and can easily make a budget gaming rig with this.
customer_reviews.author: MR D A WRIGHT

customer_reviews.title: Better than most cpus older than it.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say other than lots of things about how good this is. If this is the first time moving to AMD (from intel), as it was for me, be aware you will encounter new errors and computer issues which can be frustrating. If you do have problems just go to a forum and I’m sure most experienced amd users will help you out. From a technical perspective I can tell you this thing is ridiculously fast compared to the windows xp computer they make me use at work.
customer_reviews.author: Beansmeansbeans

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant value to performance processor
customer_reviews.text: Pound for pound one of the best CPUs out there. 8 cores 16 threads and under £150 at the time of buying. Paired with a X570 chipset motherboard this is stable clocked at 4.2GHz on all cores with a Hyper 212 Evo cooler keeping it below 60 degrees even under load. Brilliant value processor that will dobthe job for a number of years. Ok, the 3000 series is out but at double the price for the 3700x the 2700 makes oerfect budgetary sense without losing too much performance.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Nykon HTID

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money and performs well.
customer_reviews.text: The CPU itself is easy to install into the motherboard. However, the Wraithspire cooler was quite difficult to install. I was only able to screw three of the four screws into my motherboard as one seemed too short to reach the hold on the mounting board; This is a problem I know others have had too with other motherboards and therefore it must be a problem with the design of the cooler. The cooler functions perfectly well regardless and is firmly in place. Performance has been excellent so far.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic processor ordered to replace my i7 6700k and it has not disappointed even on the stock cooler I'm able to achieve a 200mhz overclock on all cores its capable of more but I stuck with 200mhz to help keep temps down for the price of this processor the value is astounding the price could be £50 more and I would still be more then happy with the purchase along side my b450 board this processor breathes through all my daily tasks including editing, rendering and gaming I have it paired with a gtx 1660 6gb and 16gb ddr4 3000mhz corsair vengeance ram. Definitely one of the best value for money processors on the market 5/5 recommended
customer_reviews.author: Debbie lovegrove

customer_reviews.title: Overall great CPU, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Intel Pentium G4560 which was more than adequate for my gaming needs. However I wanted a CPU that offered better multi-tasking and ease of switching between a game and pulling up youtube or another application. This CPU was perfect and the price was great especially when you are getting 6 cores. Overall extremely happy with this CPU. The included cooler is adequate although temps do get a tad high so I would recommend a third market cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade and impressive OC performance.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome upgrade from my Ryzen 3 1200. Have overclocked this to 4ghz all cores for daily use and have had excellent stability overclocking to 4.2 with my AIO. Current hot ambient temperatures mean I probably won't bother keeping it at the higher clocks for anything other than bragging rights. Runs everything I can throw at it on by B350-F ASUS Stryx and RX570 Red Devil GPU.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cain

customer_reviews.title: Best performance to price in today’s cpu market
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between this and the newer CPU’s. Ended up buying this to leave myself with an upgrade path in the future. I’m a very heavy power user I live stream and have the encoding on maximum settings while running games and end up using between 20-30% of resources. Also do video editing and this blasts through rendering with 16 threads. If you’re a regular user this will last a very long time. Intel have lost the current gen battle.
customer_reviews.author: Here’s Mo

customer_reviews.title: I didn't seem to win the silicone lottery.
customer_reviews.text: Either my DeepCool Captain 240 is rubbish , the Arctic Silver 5 I am using is rubbish or the CPU is not a silicone lotter winner because this CPU runs very warm even at stock speeds it goes up to 67C under load. I can get it to 4.2GHz with 1.35v (I know its a good voltage for 4,2GHz) But even at that the CPU goes up to 89+C. When I saw it spike to that temperature I immediately went down to 4.1GHz at 1.3V but it was spiking to 80C so now I have the CPU set to stock settings with no overclocks. Still for a six core twelve thread CPU its a very very good CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Farrell

customer_reviews.title: It's OK for the price but upgrade if you can
customer_reviews.text: For regular office or home tasks it's the right choice, offers plenty of juice. The only regular job that makes the CPU stutter is compression/decompression. For some reason unzipping larger files is unbearably slow in my experience. For gaming it's also more than enough. Complete with an RTX 2070 it runs all the latest games very smoothly at max settings (mid 2020). I also do 3D and video editing and there you can clearly see why this is a value CPU, intended for home users. It does everything its big brothers do, it just takes time. Sometimes plenty of time. So you might want to buy a Threadripper instead if you regularly do CPU-heavy jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Herr Lange

customer_reviews.title: Amazing CPU!!!
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is simply amazing, the stock 3.4GHz is plenty but ive overclocked mine using AMD Ryzen Master to 3.8GHz with the stock cooler (any higher id recommend water cooling). The six cores works effortlessly with multitasking and never ever slows down. I use mine mainly for gaming so i cant comment on its ability with video editing, but its great for gaming and runs at a low temperature of around 60 for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Free division 2! Good performance and OC capabilities.
customer_reviews.text: CPU is awesome, really quick for the price. Easy enough to install. Cooler is good, 30 degrees temperature at idle. Haven't OC yet but probably will with a good cooler. I was hopeful about getting the Division 2 at first then I read some of the reviews...but to my surprise a few days after verifying it I got an email from AMD Rewards saying I could claim it from Uplay...and I am downloading it now! Super chuffed
customer_reviews.author: Thabs

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you use a fresh Windows install
customer_reviews.text: At first everything was unstable as I was upgrading from an Intel platform and simply transferred over my m.2 storage. After a fresh install of Windows, everything works perfectly. Great performance for an outstanding price. The CPU cooler does its job perfectly well, but it is somewhat loud so you'll probably want to replace it with something quieter. I replaced it with the Arctic Passive AM4 cooler (Alpine 11?) and it now is dead silent with only a single case fan.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing, don't let anyone fool you into goint INTEL, AMD rocks. I still am an INTEL fanboy but i'm glad i let my friend change my mind. It performs incredibly well for the price, it's not ultra powerful but it is a good processor and one of the great parts about it is the stock cooling fan it comes with it, freaking amazing. Overheat? Hell no, that's the old old old AMD, we're in 2020. Give it a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Steve VP

customer_reviews.title: Bit of a beast!
customer_reviews.text: Installed this to replace my previous eight-core processor and benchmarked my PC to a battleboat and a battleship disregarding any graphics card. I use this with the Gigabyte B450M motherboard that it is frequently bought with 16GB DDR Corsair Vengeance 3000MHz and dayum! Is it a beast. Brought my OBS streaming usage (with an Avermedia LGP Pro 2) down to 10-15% cpu usage with that and all the extra overlays and extras, making 1080p 60fps streaming a possibility. I pledge my allegiance to Ryzen.
customer_reviews.author: FugsterJ

customer_reviews.title: Bargain price, awesome value awesome performance...
customer_reviews.text: I had an 8700k before this and had to change rigs and at the price, you can't really beat it, especially for what I do as a content creator so I need a mix of single core and multi core... Apart from the tdp being much lower on the newer gen, until the price drops I think this is the best value cpu on the market... 4.2ghz with no messing about, on all i threads 16 cores, awesome bit of kit!
customer_reviews.author: Frankly Creative

customer_reviews.title: Good alrounder
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this cpu for roughly 8 months, and its doing wery fine job. I had i5 4690k highly owerclocked, but this one is basically stock and it outperforms in every scenario I tested. But there are some issues, it really dosent like high frequency ram, and owerclocking is very limited. Everything else is fine, by far the best thing, its dirt cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, great value for money!
customer_reviews.text: For this cpu it was an upgrade from my older 1700 so it was incremental performance increase. I used an all in one cooler (240mm radiator) and found that the temperature is sitting nicely between 25 and 35 degrees. For monitoring the temperature of the CPU I would recommend Ryzen master which is for monitoring the temps and for overclocking, this came packaged up and was supplied with a stock fan. I'm very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Crimson C

customer_reviews.title: So easy to Overclock
customer_reviews.text: I chose this processor as my old intel i7 was unlocked but the new ones were way too expensive. Overclocking this processor through the BIOS from 3.2 to 4GHz was super clean and easy compared to the old intel one, also the fact that it continued to run super cool under load (3rd party air cooler) and its cinebench results were pretty good. Gaming is smooth, now it's just my 1060 that needs an upgrade and it would be perfect. Also take it from a big fan of the blue team, switch to red you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Pack My Beef

customer_reviews.title: Worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded now to the Ryzen 7 2700x and wow amazing speed of the chip to match with my RTX 2070. Once they send the CPU mine was from Germany it was about 3 days to arrive and they send you an email with a link to download AMD product verification tool to confirm you have bought it and then you have to log in and will receive game code if you have the option to choose one on the day of purchase mine was The outer worlds. No problem with receiving game code or CPU, all working 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Baldnold

customer_reviews.title: Cooler and Faster
customer_reviews.text: OK I assume the 2600 is cooler than the 1600 since the heat sink is smaller and does not have a copper core. The important thing is this CPU is 10% faster than last year's for less money. For new systems you can't beat AMD for decent performance at good value. However due to the high DDR4 RAM prices you might want to consider a top 2nd hand system and maxout the DDR3 RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wayland J. G. Sothcott

customer_reviews.title: AMD chip took 2 minutes to put in. The cooler took 20.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions did not clearly state to put pressure on spring and tighten one after the other a little until all the way down. Took me a hot minute to screw it down. Was quite stressful. Comes pre-installed with thermal paste, which is a bit of a worry, as it's spread all over my CPU and tutorials have said that I should only put a little bit on it. Then again I didn't read the fine print, I just bought it because I needed it - everything else is fine I haven't tested it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Emmie

customer_reviews.title: Was it worth it. Yes.
customer_reviews.text: I got this cpu once the 3000 series came out and got it at the cheaper price. So far I had no problems . But I would say if you only got single fan or 2 fans blowing in and out, best to get another fan for blowing in, just to keep the case a little cooler. This also has helped with the turbo clocking getting at times 4.1ghz on all processors,but holding at 4.0ghz all day. This does alot for work and gaming.
customer_reviews.author: MR N A Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great processor and best value for the performance
customer_reviews.text: Having done a lot of research this seemed to be the best way to get performance at a reasonable price. I was not disappointed with what I now have up and running as I write this review. Matched with MSI Tomahawk Max, M2.0 drive , Sapphire 590 + , running windows 10 pro I could not be happier. Cinebench 15 delivers 120 FPS and a benchmark for the CPU of 1296. Good with photoshop elements and office 2010.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Fulfils its purpose
customer_reviews.text: My old gaming PC needed an update urgently. Since the Intel processors and the mainboards intended for it are in a completely different category in terms of price, I decided to go for a much cheaper alternative. The Ryzen 2700x comes with a reasonable cooler and shines like a children's spaceship - if you like that kind of thing. My purpose is fulfilled by the new system - it can handle Red Dead Redemtion 2 with my gtx 1080ti. I am satisfied and the computer looks pretty decent too.
customer_reviews.author: Kevnor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent AMD processor!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been an Intel fan so this is my first AMD processor. It's an excellent processor with good heat sink and fan. Runs quiet and cool even under stress. I've paired with Geforce 1050Ti (4GB VRAM) and it runs most of the latest games (e.g. Call of Duty Modern Warfare - 2019) really smoothly on medium or high settings. Very pleased with my purchase. Would recommend and definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JamJam11

customer_reviews.title: Improved load time.
customer_reviews.text: For me, I found my old computer would take about a minute to load a mission for Monster Hunter World and severely lag my game as I ran to the canteen, now it takes about 10 seconds to load a mission without any adverse affects to the game in the meantime which I think I can attribute to this processor because its not a graphics process. You just drop the processor into your motherboard cpu slot and attach the cooler, which already comes with paste on it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Varley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Great cpu. Replaced my son's 2600k with this as it was starting to show it's age. 6 cores and 12 threads for this price is a steal imo. I bought a 6800k for €500 on release and this matches it performance wise for a quarter of the cost. Running at 4.2GHz with a 1070 at 1080p 60Hz. Great value cpu. My son is well impressed. Streaming while gaming is easy with this cpu. Previously he was experiencing stutters. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: DRSEire

customer_reviews.title: Gaming choice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little CPU for the money. I was tempted by the i5 8600/9600 when this popped into my radar. Looked at cpu benchmarks and this cpu makes sense. Single thread isn't as good as the intel but on multicore, the ryzen has it, and overclocking it takes another step. If it's a gaming pc your building, this is becoming the cpu to have as most games coming out now are heavily multithreading. That £50-60 saving on the cpu will go nicely on some faster ram which amd make better use of than intel.
customer_reviews.author: Mr P D Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic CPU
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic price with fantastic performance to match it. Its been able to handle everything I've used it for, from gaming to streaming it's done them smoothly without any problems. As for the stock cooler, it was somewhat difficult to install. It required a fair amount of force to install which made me quite worried for the motherboard. Overall, the troublesome cooler installation doesn't take too much away from it as it does its job and keeps the CPU cool.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: It's a Beast, Stable, and Fast
customer_reviews.text: Did that rig for general daily office use and some casual gaming, in July 2018. Ever since I've had the processor slightly overclocked to 4.1Ghz never has risen tits temperature above 30 Degrees, i am however using water cooler, but i kept stock fan in the rig as it is so nice to look at, it is very quiet as well. The possessor is stable, and lightning fast, I moved back to AMD as if i was to upgrade my older Intel set up would have to buy everything Mobo the lot, at least AMD tends to stick to their socket for a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jiro

customer_reviews.title: Great processor for budget builds
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't experienced a Wraith Prism fan bundle before now. WOW, it was so easy to install!!! No messing with screws and mounts. Just pop the fan in place, latch the clips in place and push the lever to lock it all in!! Just a note to those as inattentive as me, this is a NONE GRAPHICS MODEL so dont expect your MOBO to put anything out without a dedicated GFX Card. May seem obvious to most, but it was one small detail I neglected to note!
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Class Act
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing bad that can be said about these AMD Ryzen 5 2600 CPU's. It works a treat straight out of the box and has plenty of power for what my son uses it for. I have used the stock Wraith Stealth Cooler as it works well in this build. All in all it delivers a huge bang for your hard earned cash.
customer_reviews.author: bmc

customer_reviews.title: amazing CPU
customer_reviews.text: the CPU itself is amazing for the money. i got this CPU when the price dropped originally i was going to go for the ryzen 5 2600 but when the price went down, i opted for the 8 core. amazing performance, good tdp and it runs even the most demanding games. this processor is good for gaming and high demanding tasks like rendering videos. only minor issue is the clock speed is lower than i expected but, that can be fixed with a good cooler and overclocking. I say just buy it you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tejas Dighe

customer_reviews.title: impressive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade from ryzen 5 1600, and i can say that it is well worth it as it is a step up and has alot of power to be able to game and stream at the same time. i use it with the included cooler that comes in the box and it has never gotten above 70c in sessions of gaming and streaming, highly recommended for anyone wanting extra horsepower for their system without having to pay the intel tax
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: This product doe not come with the RGB cooler
customer_reviews.text: Dead, dead annoyed, this is supposed to come with the RGB cooler, it did not.... so went a and paid another £35 for a RGB cooler, very very annoyed. So much for saving me the cash vs. buying a i5-8400 meh..........
customer_reviews.author: jamesthegoat

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen 5 2600 great price for a great cpu
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, downloaded the Ryzen power management profile from the AMD website and now Precision Boost automatically runs all cores (6) and threads (12) at 3.9Ghz, sometimes boosting as high as 4.2 Ghz, on a B450 motherboard. Lovely chip, great performance, my only very minor gripe is that the included cooler isn't silent, and I can't be bothered to go through AMD's returns process to get another one since it'll leave my pc out of action for the duration. Very pleased with the cpu though.
customer_reviews.author: Simon P

customer_reviews.title: Literally chews through anything
customer_reviews.text: My last system was running a FX 3100, so quite a big jump up to a 2700, still, everything was smooth and fast, I'd compare it to my friends coffee lake i7 and this performed below in games by a few FPS however in day to day use such as programing and web browsing the extra cores are unstoppable.
customer_reviews.author: Cali

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but not very stable or smooth
customer_reviews.text: Performs well in gaming and other workloads, but has system stability issues due to poor memory controller. You can expect microstutturing and frame spikes during gaming, making the smoothness as rough as a badgers arse. It also has high idle temps as the cpu clock pulses between max and min on idle, which is an inefficient setup. It's cheaper than intel yes, but for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Bargainer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Amazing CPU for the price. Be sure to enable XFR 2.0 and Precision Boost Overdrive the BIOS. I use it mainly for gaming and I don't have any problems with it. Operating temperature never go over ~60°C with 212 Evo cooler on ~22°C room temperature. Inaudible fans when idle, watching movies, browsing, playing light games. Gets noisy when it goes over 50°C but that depends on your case and fans.
customer_reviews.author: Andon

customer_reviews.title: quick delivery, easy install and great temps withstock cooler.
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU for this price. Really quick delivery. Also getting really decent temps with the stock wraith rgb cooler. The stock cooler was also very easy to install with the am4 board literally just clips on. Amd are doing an amazing job always glad to go team red.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Good processor, PBO works well.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and install, stock fan is great, but I upgraded it anyway as I already had a Noctual NH-D15, so just needed the AM4 mounting kit for £8. PBO is easy to set up, just needs a bit of tweaking and negative voltage offset (-50mV works well for me) and it boosts well, and is stable. Great CPU for the money.
customer_reviews.author: BillyB

customer_reviews.title: Cpu is great and works amazingly for gaming, design on the side and lots of multi tasking
customer_reviews.text: Amazing cpu, easy to install like all cpus but the wraith spire is honestly trash and I would recommend spending the 20 pounds to buy another cpu cooler as it did drop me from 80 to 50 degrees. I don't know what amazon are doing but their product checks meant that the box had a ton of dust in it, meaning the thermal paste aswell, and trust me you do not want that, but disregarding amazon this product is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Dhruv

customer_reviews.title: Probably good depending on your RAM and BIOS Settings.
customer_reviews.text: Despite saying it was I don't think this CPU was compatible with my Corsair Vengeance 16gb RAM. I tried changing BIOS settings but couldn't get them working. I'd go for the 3000x.
customer_reviews.author: Sally O'Leary

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and stock cooler surprisingly effective
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on sale and it's been great value, plus the stock cooler will handle temps just fine (assuming that you're not overclocking like crazy). LED cables a little short but besides that no real concerns. Get this to save on the cooler and spend it on your gpu instead ;)
customer_reviews.author: Dan Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Arrived a day early from the seller. Easy install and the Default fan is more than capable of cooling for games like warzone. I haven’t overclocked to turbo yet so keeping it at 3.7Ghz base which is more than enough to get 110fps+ on the games I’ve played thus far. The RGB isn’t as versatile as I imagined but I have 2 solid colours lights in the case so I imagine they’re probably affecting the colour changes.
customer_reviews.author: Sugartaters

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Processor
customer_reviews.text: Half of the price of main stream processors and performs better than most! easy to install and I have used this processor for around 12 builds now :)
customer_reviews.author: Adam T

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, nice and fast
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, just dont force anything. After my previous build I would have thought I remembered that but luckily I was worried about the pins and didnt push too hard and instead chose to turn the chip around until it slipped effortlessly in and I could lock in the pin. Runs well with my radiator cooler, and works good with Transfort Fever 2 so far but I doubt that is very much a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. N. Kamper

customer_reviews.title: The AMD Cpu you want!
customer_reviews.text: 8 cores 16 threads at a great price. It's slightly behind comparable Intel CPUs in gaming at 1080p but for the most part turn the Res up and the difference is negligible as the load is more GPU bound at that point. More bios updates for better memory compatibility should yield better performance in the months ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: So much for your money
customer_reviews.text: Value for money you can't beat AMD at the moment. I choose the 2700x over the 3600 as i'm mainly doing productivity and the extra x2 cores are useful, if i was looking for a CPU for gaming and productivity i'm have had a harder decision as the 3600 would be better from a gaming front. That said the cooler with the 2700x is a better spec than the base model cooler with the 3600 so something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of threads and comes with a cooler
customer_reviews.text: Good value for money! 8 cores 16 threads speeds up a lot of my scientific work. Also comes with a cooler, RGB lighting is a bonus. I brought the 2700x when the 3000 series is out for about a year to save money. Do consider the 2000 series if you want to save money and don't need the latest parts!
customer_reviews.author: Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value for money!
customer_reviews.text: This really is an outstanding processor for not a lot of cash. I've paired mines up with 16GB DDR4 3,000MHz RAM (Ryzen benefits from faster memory speeds) and an AMD RX580. Games are performing outstanding and my video render times have reduced significantly from my previous Ryzen 3 1200. I highly recommend this CPU and will do more builds with it for friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU - need to be rough to install heatsink/fan
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU once installed and up and running. The heatsink and fan installation is not for the timid. I've been a pc engineer for 15+ years now, and I was scared at the amount of force required to seat the screws. Once installed runs lovely though and my wife is happy with her upgrade - paired this with a Vega 56 and runs all games well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing CPU
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for building my first gaming pc after all these years of buying prebuilt computers and laptops, expecting performance and not getting it. This is an excellent CPU to use and it runs like a charm, I have never had any issues with this CPU and I would 100% recommend it to anyone who’s looking for a decent CPU for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Callum Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this processor as an upgrade with some other PC parts. It was amazingly easy to install with the stock cooler which is surprisingly quiet and looks attractive, lit as is in red. The performance of the processor (though I haven't really stressed it) is excellent for everyday computing teamed with a B450 motherboard, 16GB of Ram and an SSD ( I will upgrade to NVMe in future). Although not the latest offering from AMD it represents excellent value and I,m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: SerialATA

customer_reviews.title: An upgrade to the FX6300
customer_reviews.text: Considering that this purchase for me was an upgrade from an FX6300, I cannot praise this CPU enough. I use this with a brand new B450 tomahawk and it's a breath of fresh air. to top it all off, the fan that it came with it is almost silent. Gaming is a breeze now, the 5 2600 can keep up with anything i need. When I do get frame drops, I know it's because of my Graphics Card, which is an R9 380. I'll upgrade that soon. When I do, I know that i'll be able to game on almost maxed settings on any game with no worries.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander C.

customer_reviews.title: AMD quality as usual
customer_reviews.text: This processor has brought my ageing pc bang up to date. It's quick, quite frugal on power and runs my Windows 10 machine very smoothly with little effort. It wasn't mega expensive and was certainly worth purchasing. I would easily recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: G Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Runs great, looks great, great price
customer_reviews.text: I've typically stuck to Intel, but went for Ryzen as AMD have improved, and it's a much better price. This CPU runs great. It comes with an awesome RGB fan. Take care when removing it, as the thermal paste is uncovered. I found installation a little confusing to clip the fan to the CPU, but after a quick YouTube search it was easy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Francesca Jagger

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Hesitate to BUY
customer_reviews.text: Amazing cpu. AMD are on another level at the minute. Far more cost effective than Intel, and they actually perform better too based on benchmarks. There’s literally no reason you shouldn’t get a Ryzen chip. This cpu will keep up with the latest graphics cards withou the worry of bottlenecking whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Binns

customer_reviews.title: Very fast cpu for gaming/streaming/editing
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this from an 8350. I upgraded because of PC build simulator to be honest but yeah I've never had a PC where all the hardware is up to date I've never been so impressed with performance. Got this on a aorus x470 gaming 7 wifi board paired with 16gb corsair vengance 3000mhz and I wont need to upgrade for a long time. Definitely a recommendation from me
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this Ryzen 7 2700x CPU for sure
customer_reviews.text: 10/10 for this product the only thing I had issues with was installing the AIO onto the CPU it requires a lot more force than you would think after I managed to fit it. I have tested it and it works like a dream also the box CPU cooler is brilliant for a stock cooler keeps the temps nice and low.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jones

customer_reviews.title: Currently (Nov 2019) this has to be the best performance per dollar chip available
customer_reviews.text: 2nd Gen Ryzen so recently superseded by the 3700 but that means its even better value. If your looking to put together a low cost workstation for Video/photo editing or a reasonable gaming rig then you could do a lot worse that this. Didin't have any RAM issues as theres loads more compatible kits out there now.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cofferon

customer_reviews.title: AMD Build Suspect
customer_reviews.text: Bought AMD Motherboard CPU and Graphics card. A very poor choice. Everything is problematic even at standard settings. I think your are safer with a Intel/Nvidia build. At least they work.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great all round value
customer_reviews.text: This right now is arguably the best value CPU on the market and for good reason it was a simple and straightforward build rock solid at 4ghz all cores for 1.275v running low 60C at 100% load under a dark rock pro 4. The one issue I have is I can't get get my ram to run at the rated 3200MHZ It's on the qvl list it's Samsung b die the motherboard supports it after hours of messing about I just settled to run the kit a little slower. That said all in all I'd definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Eckstein

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu, stock cooler is trash
customer_reviews.text: This cpu is very good value for money. Definite buy for those looking at a mid range pc thus are on a budget. Achieves decent fps in some CPU intensive games (such as battlefield), however the stock cooler is garbage in this one. I highly recommending getting another cooler, maybe even an aio cooler since then you could oc this to 4.1-4.2ghz (assuming you don't get terrible luck with silicon lottery). Overall , very good cpu, and in my opinion, the only ryzen cpu worth buying for gaming right now (unless going low end or for apus).
customer_reviews.author: Josh Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Runs fine on ultra high
customer_reviews.text: I was debating getting this or the more expensive 7. This runs everything fine without too much heat either. I'm managing on air cooled alone. The wraith fan that comes with it is great and there is no real need to change it. Easy to install too (this was my first build so I needed easy).
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bowring

customer_reviews.title: Faulty out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Installed the CPU on a B450 Aorus Elite motherboard with 32gig RAM switched on and nothing happened appears to be a Video issue as there is NO screen display swapping RAM does nothing. SO when replacement Ryzen 7 arrives this one will be returned for a refund
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Hayward

customer_reviews.title: Great budget CPU
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with my RX580 and the work we together. This CPU is great handles steaming and recording with the GPU very well at 60fps on most titles. But don't expect much from new new games like Modern Warfare. The CPU cooler is a little hard to install due to springs and makes some noise but other than that it's a super good cpu and I recommend it to anyone doing a budget build. Get this over the Ryzen 5 2600 it's only 11 pounds more and delivers so much more power. It's worth it. And it uses less Watt power.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Pesek

customer_reviews.title: Great chip
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little chip. Especially for the price point. Hasnt skipped a beat. I have a e33 cooler on it and got a modest 4ghz overclock paired this with an EVGA FTW ACX 3.0 and gets 80-100 fps in call of duty modern warfare ( gaming being the primary use case) I would suggest going for the 3600 and an X570 for the extra features
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Amd s best so far
customer_reviews.text: just running it a stock, great CPU, maxes out games, only 2k for me as Vega 64 not really able to run 4K, looking for ward to pairing this with the new Radeon VII. I have always bought AMD, if you game alot then they really do give you the best bang for your buck, difference with this one is that is better then the Intel CPU's in all departments. Great job AMD
customer_reviews.author: JamesWalker)

customer_reviews.title: Overclocked to 4ghz no problem
customer_reviews.text: Great cpu for the money had a stable overclock at 4.2ghz with a Corsair h100 aio cooler temps were fine after 2 weeks pc started to crash when playing bf5 after some trouble shooting discovered my overclock was a little too high so backed it off to 4ghz have not had any problems since might I add it was only bf5 that was causing this problem all other games were fine
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: This processor is a beast
customer_reviews.text: This processor a budget friendly beast, although it doesn’t have integrated graphics it has 6 cores and 12 threads I upgraded it from a i5 3570, and my computer has been running smoothly. It competes with high end cpu with integrated graphics for its price its more than worth it especially if you combo it with a good graphics card, plus if you want the integrated graphics get the ryzen 5 2400 or i5 6600k the Intel is more expensive but you lose some you win some
customer_reviews.author: Proto

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 1080p Gaming in 2020 - Incredible Performance
customer_reviews.text: I game on a regular TV without 4K - it's an OLED panel with a refresh rate of 59.9Hz. This purchase was to upgrade my aging FX8350 rig. It was a beast, but growing weary of recent AAA releases, meaning 60FPS with Ultra Settings wasn't always possible. The horror!!! Ryzen 2600 has fully exceeded my expectations, and I have been building computers since the late 90's... Bottom line - If you want a 1080/60p gaming machine, this is the processor for you. No argument 😊
customer_reviews.author: Jo and Greg

product_meta.title: AMD Ryzen 7 2700X Processor with Wraith Prism LED Cooler - YD270XBGAFBOX
product_meta.description: Style:ProcessorAMD Ryzen 7 2700X Processor with Wraith Prism LED Cooler. Note that 300 series motherboards may require a BIOS flash to be compatible with Ryzen Desktop 2000 series processors. Maximum Temperature is 85 degree Celsius. To improve the reliability and performance of AMD processors, it is critical that certain precautions are taken when using and handling them. This Topics describes the best practices and the precautions required to reduce the risk of damages to the processor, and is divided into following sections: Electrical Power Damage Electrostatic Discharge Thermal Over stress Overclocking.
feature_bullets: Frequency: 4.3 GHz Max Boost. Base Clock 3.7GHz
Compatibility : Windows 10 64 Bit Edition , RHEL x86 64 Bit , Ubuntu x86 64 Bit
Socket AM4 Motherboard Required, Supports Windows 10 - 64-Bit Edition RHEL x86 64-Bit Ubuntu x86 64-Bit

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars6,861 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
